byline.original: By ETHAN BRONNER and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Ethan Bronner reported from Jerusalem, and Dan Bilefsky from New York.

abstract: Ilan Grapel, American who is being held in Egypt as Israeli spy, is expected to be released in exchange for scores of Egyptians held in Israel.
snippet: Ilan Grapel, an American law student from Queens, is expected to be released in the coming days in exchange for scores of Egyptians held in Israel.
lead_paragraph: Ilan Grapel, an American law student from Queens, is expected to be released in the coming days in exchange for scores of Egyptians held in Israel.

headline.main: American Held in Egypt as Israeli Spy Could Be Freed
headline.print_headline: American Held in Egypt as Israeli Spy Could Be Freed
headline.seo: Ilan Grapel, American Held in Egypt as Israeli Spy, Could Be Freed in Prisoner Swap
